@BryanWeaverDC @BenHarris_1 @thelinehotel @UnionMarketDC @erikbruneryang @WhotelDC @FullServiceRDO Of course not. And I'm glad the District and the ANC put the screws to them for it. But as far as I know, they're keeping their end of the bargain.

@BenHarris_1 @thelinehotel @UnionMarketDC @erikbruneryang @WhotelDC @FullServiceRDO Sure, Friday and Saturday night are amateur hour... but that's to be expected. But I hope you find another time to go by and experience it, then decide if it's insufferable or not. It's my favorite place in DC by leaps and bounds at the moment.

@BenHarris_1 @thelinehotel @UnionMarketDC @erikbruneryang @WhotelDC @FullServiceRDO 85% of its staff are District residents, 50%+ from Ward 1, and they even have a community center reserved for Ward 1 non-profits. When you visit, I think you'll see that it's a dramatically different way to experience DC, as a local or a visitor.

@BenHarris_1 @thelinehotel @UnionMarketDC The conversations that happen at The LINE over coffee or @erikbruneryang's food, I assure you do not take place at the @WhotelDC. Every inch of the hotel has local fingerprints, from the food to the 3,000 pieces of art to @FullServiceRDO. Locals have legitimate skin in the game.

@BenHarris_1 The 3 restaurants aren't the defining characteristic of @thelinehotel. It's the sense of community it's created â€” finally, a gathering place that isn't strictly a coffee shop, bar, or restaurant. The LINE is the most culturally significant development in DC since @UnionMarketDC.

@BenHarris_1 If you can telecommute, stop by on a weekday, grab an Americano at The Cup, then grab a seat in the lobby, plug in, get work done, and observe the creative collisions and the exchange of ideas happening around you, between locals and visitors who aren't in suits with name tags.

@BenHarris_1 Please go, then tell me if you think the same. Not on a Friday or Saturday night (because let's face it, the entirety of DC becomes one big McFadden's for the bridge and tunnel crowd on weekends), but on a Tuesday afternoon or Saturday morning.

@donetodeath @sweetgreen @garage_magazine NBD, but Iâ€™m quite advanced when it comes to Sweetgreen so I usually customize my perfect salad (whose origins trace back to the Kendrick-inspired â€œBeets Donâ€™t Kale My Vibeâ€). I applaud your bravery in the face of romaine and commitment to this important work, nevertheless.

@10000youtubes @donetodeath @sweetgreen @garage_magazine Itâ€™s not a perfect solution and does exclude some people, but itâ€™s not without reason â€” employee safety, food safety, speed. https://t.co/XGGbTDhbpE
@audrea @donetodeath @sweetgreen @garage_magazine https://t.co/BBdwLSZHhR

@drew_vkamp @cjane87 Ethiopian food, @RosesLuxury, Pineapple & Pearls, @badsaint_dc, @Sweetgreen, @cava, @andpizza... all best in the country.
But a world-class city needs more than world-class food, so whatâ€™s next? Art? Music? Fashion? Until then, DC will keep playing third fiddle to NY and LA.

@drew_vkamp @cjane87 Donâ€™t get me wrong... DCâ€™s come a loooong way and Iâ€™m proud to be a Washingtonian, but I believe the nationâ€™s capital should be its crown jewel. And itâ€™s not. DC should have the best of everything. But we donâ€™t... except the culinary scene. Weâ€™re finally in the big leagues.

@drew_vkamp @cjane87 Itâ€™s not that DC is not LA or NY, itâ€™s that it doesnâ€™t think or play on the same level. Itâ€™s the nationâ€™s capital, but is culturally insignificant apart from politics. Paris, London, Tokyo, Berlin are all federal cities, but manage to define themselves well beyond government.

@rrhoover @delk @MusaTariq What happens when a complete stranger asks for help? Take, for example, panhandlers and the homeless. Some may be deserving, some not, but these are people literally asking for help, but people (who could help) ignore them all day long.

@rrhoover @delk @MusaTariq I do believe people intrinsically want to help. But how do you qualify who â€œdeservesâ€ help? If youâ€™re privileged enough to be surrounded by quality people w/ good intentions and the skills to back it, you have an established trust level that mitigates your risk of getting burned.

@VivekMGeorge @mustardtigers19 @atbwebb @ElisBehrmann Besides my personal experience examining Teslas, take your pick... https://t.co/YZ5yoxerqM

@VivekMGeorge @mustardtigers19 @atbwebb @ElisBehrmann Tesla reliability is solid (so far), but fit & finish are trash vs. traditional OEMs. Cheap materials, obscene panel gaps, paint overspray. Early adopters will forgive. But donâ€™t get it twisted, Tesla is still very much trying to figure out how to build cars with precision.

@atbwebb @ElisBehrmann Also, letâ€™s not forget... you can have the fanciest electric car on the road, but if you canâ€™t charge them anywhere, it doesnâ€™t matter. @Teslaâ€™s Supercharger Network is eons ahead of the other OEMâ€™s efforts. Good luck to the Germans.

@atbwebb @ElisBehrmann â€œThe vehicles Iâ€™ve seen are far superior to anything Tesla has.â€
True, the Germans will try to attract consumers with fancy bells and whistle, but theyâ€™ll still be cars with computers in them. Teslas are computers that happen to be cars, which will remain their competitive edge.

@1a Heads up, 1A team... if you start at tweet with @person, the only people that will see it are those following BOTH you and @person. You unfortunately need a . before the @ or rephrase it. So .@jejohnson322 for example.

@1a @LoganLaurice I have black friends who criticize @DearWhitePeople for oversimplifiying the issue of race. But race is complicated. I loved the show and think DWP can make it digestible for those still â€œawakening.â€ Should DWP be written for the lowest common denominator or highest?
